Reviews.Title: Description of the phone
Reviews.Author: Rachael
Reviews.Content: This information that is given for the phone is not enough. it needs to have more of a discription of the phone and it's features. Such as: if internet needs to be a maditory purchase for the phone, more discrpted pictures of all the details f the phone there is only on picture where you can see the phone sliding upwards not one that shows it slides to the side as well.

Reviews.Title: AT&T; PANTECH PHONE
Reviews.Author: William D. Saumier "Bill Saumier"
Reviews.Content: This is the second one we purchased.  The first one lasted a couple years and was used on a regular basis.  Pretty good phone.  The better half likes the phone so much she wanted another.

Reviews.Title: I got this as backup.
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I broke my phone and needed a phone I could use until I got a new one. It was only $20 bucks and I had one before, but this one is different. Its built different and its THICK. I almost couldn't text because it was soo thick. It sucks.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for the most part (UPDATED 01/17/2013)
Reviews.Author: T. Wills "AzNetCowboy"
Reviews.Content: I would have given this phone a higher rating, but it was listed a NEW and it was not. The box had been previously opened before my receiving it. I liked the dual keyboards and the fact it quickly sync'ed up with the MS SYNC in my Ford. However, the flaws that made me finally return it were:1) The SIM card from my old AT&T; phone didn't work as it should. I had to manually, one at a time, copy my SIM contacts to the phone and edit them. Lots of time wasted here.2) the limitation on the external memory on this newer model phone were restricted to 2GB, but my microSD had 8GB and was not recognized. My older Pantech had no problems with the 8GB card.3) The fact that I had to pay the shipping back to Phones, Etc. I am admittedly unhappy with that, but I did so anyway. It was not a "Prime" listed phone, so I bit the bullet.There is a caveat to #3. They had no problems with my returning the phone. I have ordered another phone from them and this time I made sure I order a "Prime" listed phone.UPDATE (01/17/2013):After further communications with Phone Etc., I realize my comment about the phone not being new was incorrect. I do not know how a phone is unlocked, but they assured me it was new and it was necessary to open the box to unlock the phone. For this error on my part I owe an apology to Phone Etc.I also updated my review of the Pantech Duo C810 cell phone from 3 stars to four stars. For most people ordering this phone, the things I found annoying and problematic won't be for them
